intro: Euphorbia insulana var. tovarensis, commonly known as the Tovarensis spurge, is a succulent plant native to the island of La Réunion. It is characterized by its cylindrical, segmented stems that are typically green to reddish in color. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers clustered in a structure called a cyathium, which is typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is often cultivated in rock gardens and as a houseplant.
